title: Butch Jones: "Facing Derrick Henry will be a great challenge"
text:

Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Butch Jones: "Facing Derrick Henry will be a great challenge" Mark Bergin, WBIR 2 p.m. EDT October 21, 2015 Butch Jones addresses the media prior to Saturday's game against the Alabama Crimson Tide. (Photo: WBIR) 4 CONNECT 5 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
(WBIR – KNOXVLLE) Tennessee Volunteers coach Butch Jones was complimentary of Alabama as his team comes off of a bye week. 
Tennessee takes on Alabama on Saturday, and the Vols haven't beaten the Crimson Tide since Oct. 21, 2006. 
“If Alabama makes you one dimensional you’re in for a long day,” Jones said. 
Alabama comes into Saturday’s game with a 6-1 record (3-1 SEC). 
The Crimson Tide have won at least 10 games in every season since 2007. 
“They really resemble the difference of building a football team and building a football program that’s stood the test of time,” Jones said. 
Alabama junior running back Derrick Henry is second in the SEC with 901 rushing yards. He's also second in the SEC with 12 rushing touchdowns. (Photo: Scott Halleran, Getty Images) 
Alabama running back Derrick Henry ran for a career-high 236 yards and two touchdowns in last weekend's 41-23 win against Texas A&M. 
“Facing Derrick Henry will be a great challenge,” Jones said. “Obviously, we have to be a great tackling football team because he’s shown the ability to break arm tackles, but also he can make you miss at the second and third levels of a defense.” 
Jones said the Vols tight end Neiko Creamer has been used in practice to try to replicate Henry. 
Henry has run for 125 yards or more in four games this season. Henry has scored a touchdown in all seven games Alabama has played this season. Henry is averaging 5.9 yards per carry. 
"They have complimentary players with diverse skill sets, and that’s what makes them very, very challenging to prepare for,” Jones said. 
Tennessee is 4-7 all-time in games played in Tuscaloosa. Before the two teams played in Birmingham. 
The Vols last won on the road against Alabama on Oct. 25, 2003. 
Tennessee plays Alabama at 3:30 p.m. Saturday on CBS. 
Note* Stats on Graphiq charts have not been updated since Alabama's 41-23 win against Texas A&M. 4 CONNECT 5 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://on.wbir.com/1LLJ3lz TOP VIDEOS
